# Changing Style via CSS 

Updating the CSS allows you to change the UI of our components to meet your needs.

This section will guide you through an example of updating the look of headings. Note that the process can be applied to update any HTML tag from within SuperTokens components.

## Global style changes

### How to make changes

First, let's open our website at `/auth`. The Sign-in widget should show up. Let's use the browser console to find out the class name that we'd like to overwrite.

<img width="500px" src="/img/thirdparty/inspect-button.png" />

<img width="500px" src="/img/thirdparty/inspect-button-2.png" />

Each stylable components contains `data-supertokens` attributes (in our example `data-supertokens="headerTitle"`). 

Let's add a `headerTitle` attribute to our configuration file. The syntax for styling is the same as <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/react/react_css.asp" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">React inline styling</a>

<FrontendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="reactjs">

```tsx
SuperTokens.init({
    appInfo: {
        apiDomain: "...",
        appName: "...",
        websiteDomain: "..."
    },
    recipeList: [
        ThirdParty.init({
            palette: {...},
            // highlight-start
            style: {
                headerTitle: {
                    border: '3px',
                    borderColor: "#000000",
                    borderStyle: "solid"
                }
            }
            // highlight-end
        }),
        Session.init()
    ]
});
```
</TabItem>
</FrontendSDKTabs>

The above will result in: 

<img width="500px" src="/img/thirdparty/title-border.png" />

### Changing fonts

By default, SuperTokens loads and uses the ['Rubik'](https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Rubik) font. The best way to override this is to add styling to the `container` component in the recipe configuration. Doing so will prevent the SDK from loading the default font.

<FrontendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="reactjs">

```tsx
SuperTokens.init({
    appInfo: {
        apiDomain: "...",
        appName: "...",
        websiteDomain: "..."
    },
    recipeList: [
        ThirdParty.init({
            palette: {...},
            // highlight-start
            style: {
                container: {
                    fontFamily: "cursive"
                }
            }
            // highlight-end
        }),
        Session.init()
    ]
});
```
</TabItem>
</FrontendSDKTabs>

### Using media queries

You may want to have different CSS for different viewports. This can be achieved via media queries like this:

<FrontendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="reactjs">

```tsx
style: {
    headerTitle: {
        border: '3px',
        borderColor: "#000000",
        borderStyle: "solid"
        // highlight-start
        "@media (max-width: 440px)": {
            border: "5px",
        },
        // highlight-end
    }
}
```
</TabItem>
</FrontendSDKTabs>

## Customising the Sign-Up / Sign-In form

These are the screens shown when the user tries to log in or sign up for the application.

<FrontendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="reactjs">

```tsx
SuperTokens.init({
	recipeList: [
        ThirdParty.init({
            // highlight-start
            signInAndUpFeature: {
                style: {...}
            }
            // highlight-end
        }),
        Session.init()
	]
});
```
</TabItem>
</FrontendSDKTabs>

## Customizing the OAuth callback screen

This screen is shown when the user returns to the application from the OAuth provider

<FrontendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="reactjs">

```tsx
SuperTokens.init({
	recipeList: [
        ThirdParty.init({
            // highlight-start
            oAuthCallbackScreen: {
                style: {...}
            }
            // highlight-end
        }), 
        Session.init()
	]
});
```
</TabItem>
</FrontendSDKTabs>

## Customise the Email Verification forms

### Send verification email screen 

This screen is shown when the user logs in and is redirected to a screen which asks them to send an email verification email.

<FrontendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="reactjs">

```tsx
SuperTokens.init({
	recipeList: [
        ThirdParty.init({
            // highlight-start
            emailVerificationFeature: {
                sendVerifyEmailScreen: {
                    style: {...}
                }
            }
        }),
        // highlight-end
        Session.init()
	]
});
```
</TabItem>
</FrontendSDKTabs>

### Verify email link clicked screen

This screen is shown when the user clicks the email verification link on their email.

<FrontendSDKTabs>
<TabItem value="reactjs">

```tsx
SuperTokens.init({
	recipeList: [
        ThirdParty.init({
            // highlight-start
            emailVerificationFeature: {
                verifyEmailLinkClickedScreen: {
                    style: {...}
                }
            }
            // highlight-end
        }),
        Session.init()
	]
});
```
</TabItem>
</FrontendSDKTabs>
